result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chandler L Pierce in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Chandler L Pierce in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Parties to proceed without PSI.  950 complied with; no victim statements provided.
State's recommendation:
15CF831:  3 yr probation
15CF1040:  dismissed and read-in
15CF1679: Cts 1&3-18 mos WPS 18 mos ES i/s, consecutive to 15CF1418and each other, 3 yr probation.  
15CF1886:  18 mos WPS, 6 mos ES i/s, consecutive, 3 yr probation
16CF687: Ct 1: 6 mos RCJ cs to hit & run, Cts 3&4: 2 yrs WPS 2 yrs ES imposed/stayed, cons to all, 3 yr probation.
15CF1418: Ct 1: 4 mos RCJ, Ct 2: 1 yr WPS 1 yr ES, imposed/stayed, 3 yr probation.  Ct 3: previously dismissed.
Defense sentencing recommendation.
Statement by defendant's mother.
Statement by defendant
BTC:
15CF831: Cts 1, 2 & 3 - withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation each count concurrent.  DNA surcharge waived. DV surcharge on Ct 1
15CF1040: dismissed and read-in at plea hearing
15CF1418: Ct 1 - 4 mos RCJ, $300 + cc, DNA surcharge waived
                      Ct 2 - 1 yr WPS, 1 yr ES cons to Ct 1, imposed/stayed, 3 yr concurrent probation
15CF1679: Cts 1 & 3 - 18 mos WPS, 18 mos ES each ct consecutive imposed/stayed, 3 yr probation.  DNA surcharge imposed
15CF1886:  18 mos WPS, 6 mos ES consecutve, imposed/stayed, 3 yr probation, DNA surcharge waived
16CF687:  Ct 1 - 6 mos RCJ consecutive to jail time imposed in 15CF1418.  
                    Cts 3 & 4 - 2 yrs WPS, 2 yrs ES consecutive imposed/stayed, 3 yr concurrent probation
Conditions for all:
participate and comply with psychiatric medical treatment, including attending appointments with therapist and taking prescribed medications
complete domestic violence class
comply with all family court orders.  
may not live with current girlfriend without approval of agent and defendant's mother
establish paternity on child due in August, there must be a specific child visitation schedule established
no alcohol, controlled substances, except for prescribed medications
obtain HSED/GED
obtain employment to extent of abilities
do not drive without valid driver's license; obtain valid driver's license
complete anger management and other counseling, etc determined appropriate
enroll in the Fatherhood Initiative Program and join a father's group at church.  
30 hours CSW
Court costs are waived
firearm prohibition warning given; voting prohibition
CIP and SAP eligible
Release today and report to RCJ 08/13/16
huber for child care and treatment
